intro: Wahlenbergia epacridea, commonly known as the rock wallaby orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to thrive in well-drained environments. Wahlenbergia epacridea is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands.
